intro: Pultenaea strobilifera, commonly known as the mountain everlasting or rock everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in dense, spike-like clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is found in regions with a Mediterranean climate. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, persistent seeds that are dispersed by wind. Pultenaea strobilifera is often used in ornamental gardening due to its hardy nature and attractive floral display.
